title: Network Tap
description: A network tap is a system that monitors events on a local network. A tap is typically a dedicated hardware device, which provides a way to access the data flowing across a computer network.
key-ideas: Does not involve packet switching; unlikely to be associated with a switch but may relate to a hub.
Interacts with the link as a shared medium, passively observing traffic as it flows through a network link.
Often used by network monitoring or IDS devices to passively observe traffic as it passes through a network.
Taps were classicly used with shared bus connections such as ethernet over coax to attach devices to the shared medium.
